resposta.texto: são o conjuntos de arquivos relacionados entre si com registros sobre pessoas, lugares ou coisas. São  coleções organizadas de dados que se relacionam de forma a criar algum sentido (Informação) e dar mais eficiência durante uma pesquisa ou estudo cientifico.

A modelação de dados são métodos que permitem modelar e estruturar uma base de dados. Essa ferramenta permite demonstrar a construção dando suporte aos processos de negócios como estará organizado os dados e quais os relacionamentos que pretendemos estabelecer entre eles

Dados são expressões gerais que descrevem características das entidades sobre as quais operam os algoritmos. Estas expressões devem ser apresentadas de maneira a que possam ser tratadas por um computador
Os dados podem ser guardados de duas maneiras: num sistema de processamento de ficheiros ou num sistema de gestão de bases de dados.

Independência de dados lógica - permite alterar apenas o nível conceitual, não o havendo nenhuma alteração o no nível externo ou nas aplicações do usuário. 
Independência de dados física - permite alterar o nível interno sem ter que alterar o nível conceitual, nível externo ou as aplicações do usuário.

Posiciona os registos no disco sem nenhuma ordem específica, ele faz o registo no final do ficheiro; 
é a estrutura de ficheiros mais simples
O ficheiro Hashed usa a função hash aplicada a um dado campo para determinar a posição de um registo no disco e tem acesso rápido a registos

Funções são blocos pl/sql com nomes, os quais retornam um único valor
• funções podem aceitar um, muitos ou nenhum parâmetro, mas sempre deve ter uma cláusula de retorno

tipos de texto (strings)
tipos numéricos (inteiros e decimais)
tipos de datas (temporais)

resposta.text: Data modeling is a method of modeling and structuring a database. This tool allows you to demonstrate the construction supporting business processes, how the data will be organized and what relationships we intend to establish between them
Data are general expressions that describe characteristics of the entities on which the algorithms operate. These expressions must be presented in a way that they can be handled by a computer)

This system is a software developed to support, maintain and access large interrelated data collections. A sgbd is a software system that facilitates the process of defining, building, manipulating and sharing the database
The data can be stored in two ways: in a file processing system or in a database management system or database management system

pergunta: levels of abstraction in a dbms
levels of abstraction in a database management system

resposta.text: external level; conceptual/logical level; physical level.
Is the ability to change the schema at one level of the database system without it changing the schema at the next level and it allows two types

There are two types that exist: - Logical independence of data: This is the ability to change the conceptual schema without having to change the external schemas or application programs;- physical independence of data: is the ability to change the internal schema without having to change the conceptual schema
The heap file positions the records on the disk without any specific order, it is the simplest file structure

The sorted file positions the records in an order according to a given field; it reads these same records in the order of the sort key values, is super efficient and does not require access to additional blocks
The hashed file uses the hash function applied to a given field to determine the position of a record on the disk and has quick access to records
Functions are pl/sql blocks with names, which return a single value- functions may accept one, many or no parameters, but must always have a return clause
Exceptions in pl/sql are used to capture exceptions, and define actions to take when they occur.
Exceptions in pl/sql are used to capture exceptions, and define actions to take when they occur.
Data can be grouped in three sets: text types (strings); numerical types (integers and decimals) and types of dates (times)

The sgbds architectures are the shared memory: has the advantage that communication between the various processors is extremely efficient but limits the number of processors that can be used; shared disk: has the advantage of a degree of fault tolerance but, when the number of disk is greater than the number of processors, communication is slow;nothing shared: each node has one processor, memory or more disks. has the advantage that multiprocessors can be expanded without interference but, has high cost of communication and access to non local disk

presentation layer: it deals with the user interface; business rules layer: contains the logic of the business/actions that must be executed to perform a task;data access layer: communicates with the database;data access management;data storage: where the data is stored as a file processing system
